result.execSummary:
The defendant James J Slater was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 30 days to pay or 12 days KCJ with huber or 12 days on work crew concurrent to 15TR1508.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for Ct. 2 only - dismissed but read in
30 days to pay or 12 days KCJ with huber or 12 days on work crew.

Minutes:  15CM172/15TR1508/1509/1510.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Jeremy Chavez.  Cases are resolved.

15CM172 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Deft fined $100 plus costs.  30 DTP.  In default, 12 days work crew or 12 days KCJ.  
Alternatives are concurrent to 15TR1508.  Count 2 is dismissed & read-in on State's motion

15TR1508 - deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Fined $200 plus costs.  30 DTP.  In default, 8 days work crew or 8 days KCJ.  Alternatives are concurrent to 15CM172.


15TR1509/15TR1510 - both traffic files are dismissed & read-in on State's motion.

Minutes:  15CM172/15TR1508/1509/1510.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Chavez.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Deft has an appt with his physician to determine whether he will be able to obtain his DL.  New offer relayed today by the State as well.  FPT adj to 6/15/15 @ 1pm on all files.

Minutes:  Court Reporter - Karen Howell.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Chavez.  Atty Chavez moves for an adjournment; deft is eligible to reinstate at this time.  However, due to medical issues, he may not be able to reinstate his DL.  Deft has appointment at DOT today.  FPT adj to 5/27/15 @ 2:30pm.  TR files are trailing.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
WSPD def is not eligible for public defender respresentation

*Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  *TO SUBMIT TO BOOKING AND PROCESSING BY 4:00PM TODAY.
  946.49(1)(a) - Bail Jumping Misd.

11:59am  State's appearance waived.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk: JPatlan.  DE acknowledges receipt of a copy of the criminal Complaint.  DE has read and understands Complaint. Def is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def's failure to retain counsel. Court enters a NG plea on behalf of DE. $500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  Court finds that DE is not eligible for diversion program and case is referred to judge.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 09:10 am.
and witness list filed by the State
